Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms and hosts!”
Reviews.Author: grandmaEthel
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Pensione Guerrato. And if I am lucky enough to travel again to Italy I shall definitely return there for the Venice portion of the trip. Because it has all the important things conducive to a good vacation stay, and at reasonable rates. First, location. Quite perfect: steps from the Rialto Bridge with its shops and several Grand Canal vaporetto stops (including one making getting to or from the train station a breeze), easy walking distance to San Marco - or, heading off in virtually any other direction from the Guerrato - to many other sights, close to both the delightful vegetable/fruit market and, a couple of blocks farther away,Venice's marvelous huge fish market (though I wasn't prepared to cook and therefore wasn't intending to purchase any of the market's wares, the market both was exciting in itself and made it clear that I was likely to be eating very fresh fish at whatever nearby restaurants chose for suppers), and a ten-minute stroll to a spot on the lagoon shore where the various boats heading out to the islands stop frequently. In spite of its central location near the hustle and bustle of various tourist attractions, the hotel is delightfully quiet due to its being set part way down a narrow alley devoid of shops or restaurants. Nights were therefore peacefully silent - even though, in my case, I usually slept (it was a warm March!) with windows flung open. Second, rooms and rest of the interior. From the burnished wood of the entrance stairs through the roomy and distinctively-decorated public area and the large bright breakfast room there is a welcoming warmth and other evidence of the hosts having taken the time to make visitors feel comfortable and, at the end of the day, likely to be glad to get back to their Venetian "home". The two rooms in which I stayed - and the couple of others that I happened to catch glimpses of through open doors - were large and lovely, each one decorated with care and with objects of quality. And clean and comfortable, absolutely. Third (though perhaps not in importance), the hosts. They are always pleasant, though never instrusive. And they are happy to aid a visitor with almost anything - planning a day's outing, catching a train or boat, finding just the sort of restaurant for which one is yearning, or simply efficiently negotiating one's way through Venice's maze of streets and alleys which, however delightful,aren't always easy to efficiently negotiate one's way through (even for one with excellent map-using skills!). The sensitivity to, i.e., the ability to understand, a visitor's individual preferences or whims was particularly notable. On several occasions Roberto quickly grasped what sort of experience I felt like. For example one day I felt like escaping to quiet "ordinary" residential streets near public gardens (and Arsenale's lions, which I'd promised my little grandkids I'd photograph for them) for half the day, while visiting San Marco and the museums bordering its piazza for the other half. And wanting to find myself outside when the light would be loveliest, I wondered how I should order these activities. He worked out a plan involving some streets - and an unpretentious little island - I'd never otherwise have visited, and certainly got the order exactly right: the day, including the the directions in which the sun shone, was one of my best in Venice. He also helped me get my islands day - Murano (the grandkids again, as I'd promised them I'd see the glass blowers and bring them some little glass objects) and Torcello (perhaps my favorite spot in Venice) - off to a wonderful start by working out, after I mentioned how lost I usually got trying to get to the aforementioned place where visitors catch the boats heading for the islands, a simple (yes, in Venice!) "back" way which combined a 50-cent across-the-Canal gondola ride (fun and cheap!) and a pleasant stroll between Canal and lagoon along a relatively straightforward and tourist-free route. And I'm convinced that in either of these cases had I (or other of his visitors) wanted a different sort of experience, the suggestions would have fit my (or their) desires rather than merely reflect his own ideas of what a good day in Venice might be. All in all, lodgings I loved - and to which, as I said above, I'll definitely return should I get to Italy again. P.S. Good WiFi too!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel near the Rialto Bridge”
Reviews.Author: Sallyjan_12
Reviews.Content: We were so lucky to find a hotel so close to everything we wanted to see in Venice. The room was large, clean and comfortable. It was right over a market, so we did close the windows at night and were not bothered by noise. The breakfast hit the spot....croissants, bread, cereal, yogurt and good coffee. Just enough to get us going in the morning. Everyone at the desk was helpful and good at guiding us to different places. It was close to the Rialto Bridge and within walking distance to St. Mark's Square. We had a wonderful stay there and would recommend it to others. It was also easy to find...right near the Grand Canal. We also recommend Murano and Burano.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Kate W
Reviews.Content: Had old charm but very noisy, Rooms were below average, walls are thin, you can hear everything from next room. Breakfast is only croissant, bread, cereal and yogurt. compare to other hotels we stayed in Italy, this hotel was the worst. Having a market right outside they should add some fresh fruit and vegies to breakfast. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice bed and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Frank E
Reviews.Content: This was a nice little place to stay. The owner was behind the counter when we arrived and was very helpful. He recommended a few restaurants and went out of his way to secure us a reservation. The place had a lot of character and charm. Also they had various Italian travel books to help you plan your stay. The rooms were decent formthe price we paid. This is not a place where you would get all the frills. We shared a bathroom down the hall, not as bad as I thought it would be. Breakfast was included and was your standard continental style food. Pastries, yogurt and cereal. A good start for your day. There is a farmers market right outside the hotel with lots to choose from. The location was located near Rialto Bridge and was easy to find. Real nice place and very good on the wallet. With the money you save, you can get a lot of espresso.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid & inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: Nesbo
Reviews.Content: Wonderful B&B near the Rialto. Good sized rooms, beautiful old furniture and fittings in the hallways etc. Very reasonably priced, comfortable, steeped in authenticity and history, we absolutely loved it. Note there are no elevators so you will have to carry your luggage up a few flights of stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Paula B
Reviews.Content: Pensione Guerrato was in a great location, near the Rialto bridge but not in the crowded area. It's also right next to the fruit market, so we ate delicious fruit every day (after so many carbs and gelato, that was especially nice!). The staff is helpful, breakfast is beautiful, there is wireless in the lobby. Great visit. Highly recommended from a family of four (two teenagers).

Reviews.Title: “Rialto location with mainland prices”
Reviews.Author: seattlexs
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful small B & B, run by friendly staff. The hosts are very knowledgable and helpful. The breakfast was delicious in a lovely dining room. The location is right near a #2 vaporetto stop (Rialto Mercato) and very close to Rialto bridge. These make getting around super easy. The rates were good for our stay. There were two of us and we stayed in private, adjoining rooms. One with ensuite bath and the other just across the foyer ... But exclusive to the room. These rooms were on the 3rd floor and there is no elevator so pack accordingly. We loved Pensione Guerrato and will definitely stay on our next visit to Venezia!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pensione Guerrato - Perfect Oasis”
Reviews.Author: javafudge
Reviews.Content: Book blindly this hotel based on review by Rick Steve's and i totally trust his recommendations. This Hotel is no different, it is so easy to get there from the train station and just a short walk from the vaporetto stop. Directions given to the hotel is spot on and though located in between tiny lanes, it is still easy to find. a short climb up the steps, you be warmly greeted by the staffs & owners. Super friendly & a lively joker with a nice moustache - very venetian. My room is located on the 4th Floor with shared toilet facilities. Room is very spacious, clean with fabulous furnitures. The only inconvenience is the 4 level steps up. Every else is perfect. I love the lobby & breakfast room. It really feels like you are in a venetian home and the green walled breakfast room with huge mirrors is a real gem! The location is great! I love the great restaurants and small eateries around the hotel which are walking distance - if you need any recommendations, just ask the staffs. They really knows everything if not everyone in that neghbourhood. The location is always buzz with actions & activities, morning will be the fresh markets, and evening will be the night markets that are filled with well priced souveniers, snacks & goodies to bring back home. food selections are in full abundance. Key tourists spots are just over the rialto bridge or vaporetto away! Perfect! Perfect is best to describe Hotel Pensione Guerrato! Grazie!

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneAlison
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay in magic Venice. The location is superb - near the Rialto bridge and metres from the Markets, and surrounded by shops and restaurants. It is a family run hotel and the service is friendly and helpful. The building goes back to the 1200's and is full of charm and atmosphere - wooden floors, antique furniture etc. We stayed in a 3 bedroom apartment on the third floor with a kitchen and dining room - very suitable for a family. View from the window across the markets to the Grand Canal. The only drawback for some people would be climbing the stairs - no elevator, so luggage has to be carried up on arrival. This wasn't a problem at all for us but may be for some. Breakfast was simple but good - cereals and bread/pastries etc. Overall we all just loved it here and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Apartment in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ann C
Reviews.Content: My family of four adults stayed in the apartment, Carampane, for three nights. The apartment is located about four blocks from the hotel (about a 5-10 minute walk). It was recently remodeled and very nice. It consisted of two large bedrooms and two good-sized bathrooms and a combination living room and kitchen. The apartment is located down a dead-end street in a residential area. You do have to walk up one flight of stairs to get to the apartment as there is no elevator. The apartment was in a very good location, close to the fish market and Rialto Bridge. The only negative thing about our stay was the chilly reception we received at the hotel. The woman who checked us in was very unwelcoming and made us feel like we were a bother. When we checked out, we got a similar response from a man. We were only at the hotel to check in and out so the chilly reception was really not a problem. However, because of that I'm not sure I would stay at the hotel but would definitely stay in the Apartment Carampane again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in an 800-year-old building”
Reviews.Author: peach509
Reviews.Content: This is why you go to Italy...you know you are not in an Holiday Inn. Great small hotel, 24 charming rooms run by two brothers, they will help you find the best local places to eat. Two minutes from the Rialto Bridge. We loved it, going back this fall.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to rest”
Reviews.Author: Scoutingitout
Reviews.Content: Venice was the third stop on our trip to Europe in August 2011. We chose this hotel because it is recommended by Rick Steves. The location was fantastic. The hotel was clean and the reception staff were professional and sort-of friendly. We stayed on the 5th floor, and it was super quiet, I don't think anyone else was staying on that floor, and so it felt spooky. However, our room faced a square, and noise from the bar below was loud at night. The room was huge, and the bathroom was big and clean. The water pressure in the shower was terrible and it was very frustrating to rinse out shampoo! The a/c worked well and was quiet. My husband developed tonsilitis in Venice, and we had to travel to our next destination a day early in order to be with family, because he was not comfortable in the hotel. The hotel owner asked us to pay for the night we missed, minus 25E. We were grateful, but would have liked a bit more forgiveness. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to any one who wants a clean hotel with a great location, doesn't mind trickling water in the shower, doesn't mind stairs and a bit of night noise. We were satisfied, but not thrilled.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Linda L
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in September. My room was on the first floor with the bathroom down the hall. To be fair, I was warned that it was a bit noisy and it was especially when they were preparing breakfast. I did like the breakfast and found staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not much else”
Reviews.Author: Rachel S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during our honeymoon. Whilst we loved Venice, we were very disappointed by this hotel. The rooms are minimalist, sparsely decorated (though clean). The female staff member who checked us in was not welcoming and seemed disinterested at all other times that we encountered her. However, the most disappointing thing about our stay was the breakfast. It consisted of 3 small bowls of cereal, luke warm coffee, orange juice, and a few stale croissants and breadrolls, with preserves. We would have thought that a hotel situated literally right next to fresh fruit and produce market could have done better - there was no fruit, no cold meats, not even any decent pastries. We were very disappointed. The only upside to this hotel was the location. Avoid it if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay anywhere else if you can stay here”
Reviews.Author: Craig B
Reviews.Content: I hesitate to write this review - in some ways I wish fewer people knew about this wonderful small hotel located a couple minutes from the Rialto. But I love to share good travel advice with people, so I've got to let others know. Roberto, Piero and Rosanna treat their guests as, well, guests! Wonderful service from them at the front desk - great recommendations for food and wine nearby. The rooms are generally quite large, and all the rooms we saw were very clean and comfortable. I stayed here with my family of 5, so we got two rooms. I plan to bring my onelifetours.ca groups here whenever I can get the bookings - the place fills up as it is also a choice for Rick Steves' tour groups. Breakfast was quite hearty for Italy - perfect to start a day of trekking through Venice's lanes. Don't spend less and stay on the mainland, pay a little more and stay here in the centre of the action (no money/time wasted on the vaporetto - just wake up, eat breakfast, walk out the door and you are where you want to be!)

Reviews.Title: “Fine Location, Bare Bones Room”
Reviews.Author: ruby50
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of October. This is a good small pensione in a great location - just a block off of the Rialto fish market. Our room was on the second floor, with a private bath. The room was very clean, as was the bathroom. We had 2 twin beds pushed together, and they were a little firm but fairly comfortable. The odd thing about our room (and we didn't see other rooms) was that there appeared to be no effort to make it inviting or warm. There wasn't a picture on the walls, or a rug covering the cold marble floor. The lights in both the bedroom and bathroom were bare bulbs that shined way too brightly. We happened to hit cool, rainy days, and maybe that contributed to the feeling of coldness, but we kept wondering, why not spend the minor dollars it would take to make the place inviting? What would the cost be for a couple of area rugs, or a couple of pictures of the canals on the walls, or some shades for the bulbs? We tend to be happy travelers and we had a great time, the people at the desk were nice and helpful, the breakfast was great. It's a fine pick especially in warm weather when you'll be spending less time in the room. It's more an observation or a curiousity or maybe a helpful hint for the owners - why not make the tiny, cheap extra effort to make an otherwise fine room more comfortable and inviting? It could make the difference between average and excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place in the heart of Venice!”
Reviews.Author: DolceVitaBellissima
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing. We recomment you get the room that includes a bathroom. The room we had was on the top floor and it was a Saturday night that we stayed there so it was quiet in the morning as there was no Fish Market on Sunday. Amazing place and great staff. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay there. I would book there again in a flash when I return to Venice. Also, the breakfast that was included was great as well. Not your typical North American style breakie with eggs and bacon...more Euro with pastries, cheeses, musli, juices - totally a carb breakie but we loved it and it suited us just fine. FYI - they also have free WiFi. A++++++

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Return”
Reviews.Author: pavrit
Reviews.Content: There were four of us (2 couples) traveling together. There weren't 2 rooms available for the two nights we were there, so we agreed to share a room. First night we were in the attic and it was a charming room with beautiful wood floors and odd shaped doors, plus windows on both sides of the room. The next night we were moved to a bigger room on the 4th floor. Though it was very nice, we all missed the attic room. Breakfast was lovely. Guests were friendly. Location was outstanding. Next time we come to Venice we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: RHA1936
Reviews.Content: Pensione Guerrato is a short way down an alley from the fish and vegetable market, a few-minute walk from the Rialto Bridge. Friendly helpful staff. Fine breakfast. Lots of stairs to climb if your room is on an upper floor. Our room was spacious as was the bathroom. There are many places to eat within only a few minutes' walk. By following the signs on buildings (to Rialto, to San Marco, etc.) one can walk to this pensione from San Marco is about 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic visit”
Reviews.Author: AlliGM
Reviews.Content: We planned a last minute visit to Venice so were very happy to find a room available. We stayed one night in the family room on the reception floor. It was large and accommodated our family of five perfectly. This room was only available for the first night so we moved to the three bedroom apartment and loved it. Our three girls loved the beds, the Murano lights, the space and the view. It is up three flights of stairs but we didn't find that a problem even for our three year old. The staff was very polite and helpful. Everything was clean and we loved the location. Plan on returning to the apartment on our next trip to Venice as four days was just not long enough.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding accommodations in the perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: yamonjon
Reviews.Content: Located just off the Rialto bridge, Pensioner Guerrato gives you comfort and convenience Venetian style! The hotel has four floors with rooms of all types. We were fortunate to reserve the top floor which has private baths and it's own breakfast service each morning. Our room was extremely large for Italy and accommodated our family of three perfectly. The view from our room overlooked a small piazza which was little noisy over the weekend night but nothing that kept us up. In the day, it becomes a wonderful meeting place for locals and it is fun to watch a little ftom the window - you feel a little like a local. Looking straight out, you are surfing endless waves of terra cotta roofs with occasional church steeples making you feel fully immersed in Venice. The owners (brothers) work very hard to ensure satisfaction and comfort. This pension is very popular with readers of a certain European travel book writer and his tour groups also use this as their Venice base so book as early as possible. We cannot imagine staying anywhere else when we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden treasure in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: toothscrubber
Reviews.Content: We ended our week long stay in Italy with a 2 night stay in Venice at the Pensione Guerrato. Rick Steves did a good job helping us chose this location and although after reading some of the reviews regarding the stairs, we decided the location was worth a try. We had excellent help from the staff. I think we met all 3 of the hosts Roberto, Piero & Rosanna who took great care. Our room was on the 2nd floor with a private bath and it had a small view into a small piazza. There was a lively bar underneath however the windows were great to block any late night noise. Internet was not available directly inside our room but in the front lobby and just outside our door (there were chairs placed in our hall) we could get wi-fi access. Our favorite part about being in this location was the fabulous fresh produce market and adjoining fish market right there! It was a fabulous experience to see locals & tourists shopping for fresh food! Pensione Guerrato is not a far walk from all the most famous landmarks and transportaion in Venice. I would definately come back and stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lots of stairs”
Reviews.Author: kcarta
Reviews.Content: Granted our stay here was very brief (one night, and barely spent any time in the room.) The location was awesome, service was ok, rooms were reasonably clean. Beware that there are lots of steep stairs. We were travelling with my parents, and while we were all fine with the amount of stairs (up one flight to get to the lobby, then up another 1-2 flights for our rooms), I could see this being an issue for more senior travellers. I, for one, would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Just can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: KelynN23
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel in a great location. The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. The free wifi was great! It didn't reach our room but there are several chairs in the lobby areas so it wasn't much of a problem. The hotel is very near the Rialto bridge but far enough away to not be bothered by the noise. We were in room #9, one floor above reception. Our room used a shared bath in the hallway. I'm not sure how many other rooms also used this bathroom but we only had to wait a short time for it on our last night. It was, otherwise, always free. The breakfast was very good. It was a typical Italian breakfast. They offered cereals, yogurt, rolls, jams, nutella, juice, and coffee. This hotel is used for Rick Steves tours quite frequently and a tour group was there during our stay. However, we hardly noticed them and I wouldn't let this deter you. It does, however, mean you should book early to get a room at this great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Daveh381
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, easy to find, with a good breakfast - room was small but had AC, which was nice, and shared the bathroom but it was never a problem. Good value for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “I liked Staying Here”
Reviews.Author: Stacy C
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a tour group but I arrived in Venice early to get a feel for Italy. I found this hotel perfectly charming. I was on the top floor but had no problems carrying my luggage up to the top floor (since I packed lightly...sadly most Americans dont). My room was large with its own private bathroom and plenty of outlets to charge my camera and laptop. I had no problems finding the hotel and they provided a great map of Venice to help newcomers get oriented to the city. There is someone at the front desk at all hours and you leave your room key with the hotel when you leave and pick it up when you return. WiFi is only available on the lobby floor, but this helps makes things social with other travelers. There is a great breakfast provided each morning by a caring staff. If I returned to Venice I would definitely consider coming back.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: WillowLM
Reviews.Content: Excellent location near the Rialto Mercado. Service was great. The owners and concierges spoke English well. Nice (free) breakfast in the mornings. Highly reccommended!

Reviews.Title: “Second Time...Excellent Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: dljones6110
Reviews.Content: Three years ago I traveled to Venice and by because of the reviews on Tripadvisor I chose to stay at Pensione Guertto. I wasn't disappointed! It was everything I expected and the location is second to none! This year we booked a cruise that departed from Venice and decided to spend a day sightseeing prior to sailing. Our hotel choice, without a doubt, was Pensione Guerrato! As a matter of fact, when I emailed to book, the hotel was full but we were put on a cancelation list. Lucky for us a room became available. With a second stay under our belt I wouldn't hesitate to go back and visit again! Stay here! You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “a great find”
Reviews.Author: europelover11
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Pensione Guerrato for three nights and loved it. It has an appealing interior and felt quite authentic. I was a bit concerned beforehand about the shared bathroom, but it turned out to be just fine. In fact, I rather liked walking through the quaint interior of the building to get to the bathroom. One thing to bear in mind is that on weekends the nearby square turns into an open bar and you can hear the revelries in the streets late into the night. I thought it was a fun part of my Venice experience, but earplugs would be a good idea if you're a light sleeper. If you decide to join in on the fun, spritz (white wine and campari, I think) is the local drink of choice :-)

Reviews.Title: “Basic, Clean, Well Located and Good Service”
Reviews.Author: HappyFeet21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in a first floor room. Great air-conditioner in the room, friendly staff. Everything was clean and our room was spacious. The room furnishings were fine, nothing remarkable, very basic - more than fair deal given the price for a room in Venice. The breakfast was also simple: cornetti, coffee and cereals. The location is excellent, a minute from the Rialto Bridge as well as a stop for the main ferry/bus that runs up and down the canal. The folks running the front desk were courteous and helpful. I would return based on location and value.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job...”
Reviews.Author: Clancy592
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly, helpful staff, great location - it's not the Ritz, but at the price, good value for Venice. Great market close by, and good breakfast. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect near the Rialto Market and Bridge. The staff is very friendly and helpful with helping English speaking customers. Our room and bathroom was large. The breakfast is very nice. I suggested this hotel to my parents on their visit a year after ours and they were as happy as we were. Make sure to stop into Drogheria Mascari close by. We will return in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place”
Reviews.Author: kookamunga
Reviews.Content: The rooms were comfortable and roomy. Very helpful friendly staff and the location was great!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!! Comfy and Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: kamaa222
Reviews.Content: Room: Although we reserved a quad room for my husband and me, and my parents, they offered us 2 rooms for 20e more a night. we took it and it was awesome. We ended up with 2 quad rooms and each had an attached bathroom. There was adequate wardrobe space. Price:The price was right for 350e for 3 nights. Cleanliness: The room and bathroom was spotless and the floors were clean. p to my normal expectations. Location:Nestled on a small and quiet street between the rialto bridge, produce market and fish market. The vaporetto line 1 stops right nearby at the Rialto Mercato stop, but it you want the express line, the number 2 line stops at the rialto bridge and you just have to walk over the bridge. Staff/owner:They were great an helpful when it came to restaurant recommendations and help with directions! A/C:the A/C was wonderful as it can get hot in Venice! Each room had its own euro unit and we could control the temp. TV:no tvs Breakfast:breakfast was yummy, with an assortment of croissants and breads with spreads and a selection of cereals. Milk, coffee, tea and orange juice was available too. Internet: free wifi, but it can't be accessed in the bedrooms and you need to be in the hallway to pick up service. Security: someone is at the desk 24 hr a day and you leave your key when you leave the hotel. Linen/Towels:provided. Remarks:I would NOT hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. I don't remember if there was an elevator since the hotel was located one floor up. OUr room was another floor up but there were rooms on the same level. This place rocked. I loved it and so did my husband and parents.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Venice”
Reviews.Author: TuckerSuz
Reviews.Content: We found the Pensione Guerrato to be a great choice in Venice. It's on a quiet alley so it's quiet but it's close to all of the major attractions so it is very convenient. I rely heavily on the Rick Steves' travel books when we travel in Europe and his tour groups stay at the Pensione Guerrato. I can see why! Our room looked out over a fruit market, which was great for picking up fresh fruit for snacks. If you've seen the movie "The Tourist", there is a scene where Johnny Depp jumps from a roof onto the canvas awning of a market and we think it's the same market! The owners are very nice and are often working the front desk. They have someone manning the desk all the time, which is nice. You turn in your key when you go out and retrieve it at the desk when you return. There were no quad rooms available for my family so we had one room on the main floor (2nd floor to Americans) and our kids (teenagers) had a room one floor up. Both of us had shared bathrooms but it really wasn't a big deal at all. I thought we'd have to wait for showers in the morning but that wasn't an issue at all. We had individually controlled AC in each room, pretty much unheard of in many parts of Europe. Beds were very firm but we found that to be true everywhere in Italy. Breakfast was in a nice breakfast room and was tasty (granola, cereal, croissants, rolls, yogurt, coffee, tea, juice). Many of the people staying there were Americans so we exchanged notes on what to do with our time in Venice. If you are looking for a reasonably priced place in Venice that is close to all the attractions yet quiet, comfortable and a good value, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value in Venice”
Reviews.Author: alolio
Reviews.Content: Guerrato is convenient to everything in Venice. An easy walk from the Rialto Mercato vaporetto stop and placed in the heart of the market itself, Guerrato is the best value we found in our entire two weeks in Italy. We were in room number one, and found it to be plenty large, very clean, and very quiet. The breakfast in the morning was surprisingly complete - coffee, tea, orange juice, cereal, pastries, and yogurt. If I were returning to Venice, Guerrato would be at the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “friendly hotel in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: artyheart
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights here. Staff is super friendly and helpful, made us feel so welcome. It's just a couple of blocks from the Rialto Bridge, very convenient to all major sights in Venice. Small shower but super clean.

Reviews.Title: “Rick Steves's recommendation was right.”
Reviews.Author: Ron48820
Reviews.Content: We are devotees of Rick Steves, and his recommendation was right on. Owners Roberto and Piero were excellent. We felt very welcome, and it's in a great location. We loved it...and Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Room With A Peek View In A Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: jmwpga
Reviews.Content: Saw this hotel on TA & one of Rick Steves' books. Nice little hotel with 25-30 rooms situated in an 800 year old building and located just a stone's throw from the Rialto Mercato vaporetto stop (a huge advantage when hauling luggage) and a very short walk from the Rialto Bridge---great location. The hotel is clean but modestly furnished and, by any standard (except for Venice, of course), is expensive at 140 Euros per night. The owners as well as the staff are helpful and provide good info when asked. Can be noisy especially at one end of the hotel near a small courtyard/piazza with a noisy bar with 50+ patrons spilling out into the courtyard at all hours. We had Room # 5 at the other end of the building and had a view below to the Rialto Market with beautiful arrangements of fruits, vegetables and a huge variety of fresh fish. The room also had a peek view of the grand Canal. All in all, a great 3 day stay in Venice which, with the benefit of hindsight, should have been stretched to 4 or 5 days. The included breakfast is served in a nice little dining room with Italian opera playing in the background. The buffet offerings of croissants, cereals, yogurts, etc. were uninspired but the ambiance helped. Tip - Beware Of Local Custom - when you tour the fruit market, don't touch the fruit. My wife did. First, the vendor grabbed the plastic bag from her, then scolded in Italian and finally ignored her completely. Very crude person but a custom nevertheless.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for a family in Venice”
Reviews.Author: 48andHappy
Reviews.Content: The Pensione Guerrato was a great place for a family vacation in Venice. We stayed in one of the apartments with three bedrooms, a kitchen and dining room, for a reasonable price by Venice standards. The Pensione is clean and run by a very friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast is included. Internet is available in the lobby. The location is great. It is close to the Rialto Bridge and a major vaporetto step. San Marco square is within an easy walking distance. There are lots of good restaurants and shops in the vicinity. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: westmotraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights prior to a cruise. The location is great...just steps from the fish and fruit market, the Rialto Bridge, and the Rialto Mercato Vaporetta stop. It is an easy walk and or Vaporetta ride to San Marcos square. Our room faced the front of the building, so noise was not a problem. Our room on the third floor, was very large with a single bed in addition to the large double sized bed (nearly king). There was an amoire for our things plus two bed stands. The bathroom was nice sized and included a bidet. As others have noted this is an 800 year old building, so there is no elevator or lift so one must be able to navigate the stairs. Roberto, Piero, Roseanne, and other staff members were accommodating They assisted us in getting our luggage to our room. Roseanna helped me deal with the airlines (using her Italian) to follow up on lost luggage. Roberto secured a phone number for a prepaid water taxi I had arranged for. They suggested great restaurants that met our needs. Roberto also assisted in setting up a tour of local wine bars for our group. When we encountered a problem with our taxi, Roberto went above and beyond to make it right. A light breakfast was served in a large, nice, bright room. It included fresh croissants, rolls, cheeses, yogurt, cereal, juice, coffee and tea. I strongly recommend this reasonably priced hotel for those wanting to truly experience Venice.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: VacationBound57
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a wonderful stay! Located in a ancient palace built in 1227 - very close to the Rialto Bridge - our room looked out over the Fish and Vegetable Market - which was fantastic! We could see the Grand Canal from our window! An absolute must is to go to the restaurant "Ai Quattro Ferri". We read about it in Rick Steves' Italy book - and we sat at a long table with other patrons - the group next to us recommended what they were eating - said it was the BEST meal they had EVER had - so how could you not order the same thing! We did and they were right - it was the BEST!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: Reader71
Reviews.Content: The Pensione Guerrato was a great choice because it made getting around really easy due to its great location. The room was clean and comfortable. No frills. The bathroom was large. The breakfast was good. The decoration made us feel very Venetian. The view from the room was nice. The staff was helpful. We are recommending it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: Drowninginyears
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here as members of a Rick Steve's tour. Robert is the perfect host and speaks English fluently. The rooms are quite nice, quiet, and large for Europe. The location is close to the Rialto Bridge and vaporetto. It is close to the fish market but we saw this as an advantage. We really enjoyed the Pronto Pesce restaurant which is just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful hotel staff and amenities!”
Reviews.Author: janelkiyomi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because this is where Rick Steves stays while in Italy. The hotel is located super close to a Vaporetto stop and near a really awesome open market. It's also within walking distance to some of Venice's major attractions - St. Mark's Square, the Rialto Bridge, etc. Our room was clean and nicely decorated with glass chandeliers and antique furniture (although, because of all the water, there was definitely a bit of a musty smell - expect that everywhere though). The staff was helpful and gave us great suggestions for places to eat. We didn't get to ride around in Piero's motorboat like Rick Steves does, but maybe next time :) The only problem was the early morning noise from the market being set up, but it was nothing some ear plugs couldn't handle!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Meredith_8255103
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were very fortunate to have found the Pensione Guerrato via a recommendation so I was forced into replying to the lady from Ohio who wrote such a dreadful review of this charming hotel. She says she was with husband and teenagers and I realise that Europe is definately not a cheap destination but I doubt I would have booked rooms without bathrooms travelling with teenagers. These rooms are all on the foyer floor and so is the reception and diningroom-and unfortunately breakfast has to be ready for early departures etc. and I don't think anyone could get breakfast ready in these old hotels with any degree of "quietness", especially with wooden floors! The position is amazing and exceptionally easy to find-and believe me if you are new to Venice you would bave to be an "expert puzzler" to figure out the streets at first-when you "get it" it is very easy. The breakfast is great and included-which doesn't happen often in other countries in Europe and is a lovely change. Our room was clean, tidy and updated bathroom-considering it is an old convent it is beautifully kept and a real honour to stay here!! I am very sorry that she didn't enjoy her stay but you have to be sensible when paying cheaper prices-if it sounds too good it probably is!! The owners are your point of contact when you email this hotel and I am sure they will happily put your minds at rest if you have any questions regarding your future stay. Enjoy your stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location - but get a room with a bath!”
Reviews.Author: LandscapesLandmarks
Reviews.Content: This pensione is a favorite of Rick Steves located near the Rialto Bridge. We stayed two nights â€“our first two nights on a two-week trip through Italy. I like to come into Venice to start an Italian trip â€“ the pace and intensity gets you right into Italian life without spending a lot of time figuring out transportation. The Rick Steves tours had booked most of the rooms a year in advance at the time we were there so we took one of three first floor rooms that shared a bathroom, which wasnâ€™t ideal. Thereâ€™s probably a reason the tour doesnâ€™t book these rooms. The room was pretty basic â€“ I suspect the upstairs rooms with private baths were nicer, given the comments I overheard from other patrons. Roberto and Pierro were very engaging and helpful at the front desk. Very good breakfast. Good location within Venice â€“ lots of energy -- but the noise level was a bit of an issue for us â€“ both with the disco around the corner going at night fairly late â€“ then the market vendors opening early in the morning. I wouldnâ€™t stay again unless I was to find that the other rooms were more gracious and quieter. In the past I have stayed in a small, basic pensione â€“ San Trovaso â€“ south of the Accademia Bridge which I probably preferred more. A much more quiet and peaceful neighborhood, but the trade-off is that it was not as centrally located â€“ so more walking to the major sites, if that is an issue for you.

Reviews.Title: “Not the ideal stay”
Reviews.Author: KatieXU
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that our stay was not ideal. There was a large group staying in the hotel, and thus we agreed on the "emergency" room (DO NOT do that). I know that this room was not representative of the rest of the hotel, so I will not comment on the rooms. What I can say, though: - This hotel was just off the Rialto Market water taxi stop (convenient), though taxis do not always stop here on nights and weekends. - This hotel was not in the best neighborhood. My cousin and I were very nervous coming back at night - there was a nightclub-type place nearby and MANY "goth"-looking young people milling around. The ally the hotel was on was dark. - With the exception of one very friendly guy, the staff was downright rude. They acted like we were bothering them whenever we came by to sign in, ask a question... We were extremely frustrated that they wouldn't help us figure out how to get to the airport in the morning from the hotel. - Breakfast was poor. Very limited selection of pastries and cereal. I made "hot" tea but the water was luke-warm.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a great location in Venice (near Rialto Bridge)”
Reviews.Author: Rosings_Park
Reviews.Content: We started an Italy trip in Venice at Pensione Guerrato. They made us feel welcomed and we loved our top-story room. Great breakfast! Clean rooms and beautiful regional decor. Recommended: the weather was warm so we opened the windows at night but that let in the mosquitoes and the noise from the plaza. Take earplugs and repellent so you can sleep comfortably. The centralized location was great for this first-time visit to fabulous Venice!

Reviews.Title: “If Rick Steves stays here, why shouldn't you?”
Reviews.Author: althorper
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel makes it a great place to stay - location close to the Rialto bridge and the Rialto Mercato vaporeto stop, comfortable and quiet accommodation, great breakfast by Italian standards, friendly and helpful service, and above all price. This is not the luxury that you may find elsewhere for much more money. However, there is still attention to detail in cleanliness and service. However, for those of us on a moderate budget, we can stay right in the heart of Venice and experience its beauty after the day trippers have gone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ab494
Reviews.Content: Pensione Guerrato was a wonderful hotel to visit during the beautiful Christmas time Venice. It truely is a pure Venetian inspired hotel and is in a wonderful location right next to the Rialto bridge and the fish market which has easy access across the grand canal. The fish market starts setting itself up early hours of the morning, although if your windows are closed then you cannot hear it, but it is a great sight to see at Christmas time. The breakfast was good and a traditional continental European cereal, toast, pastries and biscuits etc etc. The access to the hotel is via a small side street and then up three flights of stairs so access for the handicapped or elderly may be a challenge. The bedrooms were comfortable and in traditional layout/decoration which was expected in Venice!! It is in a wonderful location and perfect for a day which culminated of waking and viewing the sun-rise, returning for a nap, the re-awakening to discover the city covered in snow and ice. The hotel is a great un-chained hotel and its character shines through, especially in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “generous sized rooms with beautiful furnishings”
Reviews.Author: tripper1811
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my whirlwind 24 hours in venice. It's very easy to find and get to from the train station on the vaparetto - just hop off at the fish market and it's right in front of you down a little laneway. Have a look at their website for the history of the hotel. It says on the website that there are stairs and that they are the traveller's responsibility to carry them, however the staff happily obliged without asking to carry my bags up to my room. I got the breakfast included which was a simple continental - all you need really! The rooms are stunning and the staff were very friendly. Venice accommodation is expensive wherever you go, but I found this to be good value for money. Don't stay here if you are expecting a hotel with new modern facilities. It makes up for it in charm and history. Good location, moments away from the Ponto Rialto.

Reviews.Title: “For location & price in Venice at the...”
Reviews.Author: JenRar
Reviews.Content: For location & price in Venice at the busiest time of year (film festival, regatta storia, architecture biennale) you can't go past this gorgeous pensione. Venetian Vin Diesel will greet you and tell you how to get around. If you are lucky he'll draw you an artistic little map! Some rooms have air-con and some don't, same with bathrooms so confirm when booking. Double glazed windows keep most of the night noise out. Clean rooms, beds are twins that clip together but this is not an obstacle to snuggling. Free wifi & basic breakfast included. We would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Keep looking elsewhere...”
Reviews.Author: lisalycmh
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that I booked this room 6 months in advance, and have stayed at lots of Rick Steve's places. So I kinda had my expectations - certainly not luxury, but decent, well run, 2-star accommodations. Our quad room was 180 Euros a night for a Friday/Saturday night stay. Our Venice trip didn't start well, but the room made it worse. We arrived in Venice on a train 1 hour delayed due to a general strike in Italy, only to be run around another hour and a half by the vaperetto pass staff (Really.. 5 different kiosks to get my //venice.connected 48 hour passes... Really!), haul our luggage on the vaperetto, get immediately checked by the police, and then finally haul our luggage up the stairs to the Pensionne... Only to be given a room right off the lobby/dining room that smelled musty and had dead bug stains (mosquitos?) smeared down the walls. The hotel is nicely located - great to be by the Rialto area - but really, no excuse for the condition of the room. We were there for only two nights. The next morning, we woke to the sound of the dining room dishes clattering. We found the bathroom was moldy. We ate in the dining room, and it was REALLY crowded. Too crowded. Couldn't even sit tucked in our chair without bumping into the people behind us, and we are not large people. We came back to our room the next night to a huge group of people right outside our room. I guess the only place the internet worked was right outside our room in the lobby, and there were at least 15 people, some leaning against our bedroom door sitting on the floor. It was awkward to get them to move just so we could get into our own room... Anyway, the next morning we were awakened REALLY early by the REALLY LOUD voice of the guy behind the desk. As we checked out, I mentioned my disappointement that I had booked ahead so far, and got a room with mold and dead bugs, and he told me very loudly that it was all MY fault about the mold, dead bug smears and loud reception because I didn't complain early enough. So if you stay here, just be sure to complain really early, or better yet, just stay somewhere else! My husband swears never to go back to Venice again after this trip.

Reviews.Title: “More like a Motel 6â€¦This is Not worth 135 Euros per night...”
Reviews.Author: wtschumy
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was the only thing we could find on the island that was near enough to piazza San Marco at the time. This was the 3rd out of 5 hotels we stayed in during our 21 day vacation in Italy. I can say that it was the least impressive and the most expensive of them all. In addition to being dark and smelly, the hotel host was intolerant, rude and impersonal in his treatment. And he trains his staff to be just like him! The breakfast was not what they advertise on their website. The room did not have tabletop or raised frame where one could put baggage. We ended up having to scoop down to open and pick through our suit cases on the floor. They could learn what hospitality should be like from their compatriots in central and southern Italy where they seem to know a little more about hospitality. Granted that Venice is expensive and crowded in July. Maybe thatâ€™s why the locals always seem cranky and may feel they can bite the hand of those that give them the business. They most have it figure out that there are more naive tourist waiting in line begging for their poor excuse of hospitality. During our 3 day stay in Venice I heard several local shop keeps express their disgust for tourist. I have a feeling that the folks that run the Guerrato think the same.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Special Spot”
Reviews.Author: wdarrah
Reviews.Content: This is the nice pension I have ever stayed in. As for the reviews that did not like it, I think they expected a hotel. My family and I stayed in the 3 bed room apartment that was plenty quite and cool (AC worked great). It was dark and musty, but if you are greatly bothered by this I would not suggest staying in an old building built on the see. The character of the lodging was superb, with antique furnishings. Breakfast was good, standard yogurt, bread, and spreads. Best of all was the staff. The owner operator was very helpful, from recommending and reserving a good dinner spot where we could eat well and take our 2 and 4 yr old to general tips. I don't think very highly of Venice, to many tourist and shops, but everyone should see the history. If there you won't do better than here. Should be noted that the hotel has no ground floor rooms and is without a lift.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay, easy to get there and to get around, great location, wonderful hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: HrComsTrbl
Reviews.Content: Went on a Cruise, ending in Venice...this was the city that I most wanted to see, and it didn't disappoint!!!! We had two nights at the Pensione Guerrato. I couldn't ask for a better host, room, or location, and very reasonable for Venice! The breakfast was a nice touch. We overlooked the Market near the Rialto Bridge. Venice was magical!!! Make sure to just wander, getting lost in Venice is half the fun. We found some amazing places, by accident!!! We took the Water Bus everywhere! The stop was only a short distance from the hotel. We went to Murano and Burano on the water bus. I loved the amazing colors of the homes in Burano. I would have liked more time there! It was easy to get from the hotel to the Alilaguna Water Bus to go to the Airport. I definitely want to go back to this city to explore, and wouldn't stay anywhere else. I loved all of our ports, but this was my absolute favorite!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: Arthur069
Reviews.Content: very kind, accommodating staff! the rooms are very clean and comfortable and the breakfast in the morning ,delicious. i would recommend this location for anyone who wants nice accommodations at a resonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Hope we get to stay here again some day.”
Reviews.Author: muzikjunky
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about our experience at Pensione Guerrato. We stayed three nights and loved every minute of it. We would have breakfast, do some walking, stop at the room to freshen up and continue on our way to the next experience. The fresh fruit and vegetable market and fish market were one of the best experiences and we were right in the middle of all the action. The staff was most helpful. The smell of breakfast was so enticing and just as delicious!! Thank you for the wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Breakfast, Staff Could Be More Helpful”
Reviews.Author: solga
Reviews.Content: Loved the location and full, huge breakfast. Liked getting help with our luggage up the many stairs both on arrival and when we left. The room itself was very dark and dreary. The front desk staff and owner were surprisingly dismissive seeming to want to spend more time doing paperwork and being on the web then being helpful. We're pretty independent travelers but as this was our first trip to Venice it would be nice to be able to get some advice. Think I'd try another location on a future stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Apartment, Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: WadeWorldWide
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just recently returned from a trip to Italy and Germany with another couple. Our accomodations in Venice were at Piccolo Guerrato, the apartment run by Pensione Guerrato, and it could not have been a better experience. The apartment was very clean, modern, and very spacious! We were immediately comfortable. A fully stocked kitchen (FYI, stove top but no stove) made shopping at Rialto Market and cooking in with fresh pasta a highlight of our trip. Wonderful location next to San Marco, but not too close to the crowds. Really felt like we were living in Venice not just staying for a few nights. But it was the owner, Roberto, and Pensione Guerrato staff that helped make our experience so great. Extremely friendly, very helpful, and a pleasure to speak with. We would recommend to anyone who goes to Venice. We will definitely be staying if we return! Thank you Roberto!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: madhatr00
Reviews.Content: The Pensione Guerrato was a descent hotel in the heart of Venice. Very basic room on a side alley just off the Rialto Bridge that was extremely accessible from the Vaparretto. It was a little difficult to get to from the airport water taxi because the stop was on the other side of the Rialto Bridge, so there were a lot of steps and we had two pieces of luggage. The bed was very hard and although i was tired after a long day of traveling from the States in Venice, it wasn't the best sleep. On the plus side, the front desk staff was very helpful with finding nice places for lunch and the location is fantastic. It's about a two minute walk to the Rialto Bridge and a 5-10 minute walk to Piazza San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, great value in Venice”
Reviews.Author: globalfish
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located in Venice, close to the Rialto Bridge and vaporetto stop and a short, scenic walk to anywhere in Venice. We have stayed here twice (2009, 2006) and experienced friendly sevice, clean, comfortable rooms and ample breakfast each visit. We had a room overlooking the fruit and vegetable market which made us feel a part of the city in a special way. Free WiFi but only in some parts of the hotel, including lobby. Very nice place!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint spacious hotel in great location with nice breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: gailwallace
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and loved the location and quaint authentic feel of this old building. We had a triple room several floors up, which is quite a hike, but the room was large with a beautiful bathroom. No elevator, no television and internet only available on the lobby floor. Staff was responsive but not very outgoing compared to the rest of our stay in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience, value, nice folks, and the flavor of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Traveladdict1952
Reviews.Content: We learned of this Pensione from Rick Stevesâ€™ book, and so we signed up. It was a great place to stay, as long as you remember the building is from 1200's (no elevator, no tv in rooms, a lot of antiques, etc.) Very convenient location, about 2 minutes from vaporetto stop. The owners and their employees are extremely friendly, helpful and accommodating, and the breakfast got us off to a good start. Would definitely recommend this to anyone wanting to stay somewhere to get the â€œflavorâ€� of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hidden gem, in an incredible location”
Reviews.Author: CanadianDeparture
Reviews.Content: This was without a doubt the best hotel we stayed in while in Italy. the staff were so friendly and helpful. the hotel was very clean and had a wonderful old world smell and charm to it. We had the attic room and found it to be amazing. lots of room with a nice view (just watch your head). The beds were comfortable and the room was very clean. it was a lot of stairs to climb (no elevator) but it wasn't too big of a deal. The price also made this an affordable stay in Venice, one of the best hotels at half the price. You can't really beat the location either, just off the grande Canal. It's just a short walk to the Rialto bridge, and a nice walk to Saint Mark's square. You will love this hotel, and is the first place you should look for a wonderful stay in venice. Directions: take the #1 boat (don't forget to buy your ticket 6.50 euro) and get off at the Rialto Mercato stop. walk straight through the arch in front of you. then turn right, you will see market tables. take your second left (they are small alleys) and you will see the sign. it will take less then a minute to walk from the stop to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: NicoleCobleigh
Reviews.Content: We loved this quaint little hotel, and the lobby and hallways smelled sooo wonderful. We never did find out what made them small so delicious, but we did enjoy the complementary morning breakfast. This is a great location and right in the hub of all the fun activities in Venice. If/when we return to Venice, we'll stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: happyhiker10
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. Charming, spacious rooms, affordable, central location, staff speaks English, good breakfast buffet. Kept rooms too hot and noisy bars nearby. Windows double pane to keep out noise, but, if you want to open the windows for fresh air, it is too loud.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: family5-2010
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. Everyone was helpful and friendly. The best breakfast we had all 10 days in Italy. We can't wait to go back to Venice and will definately stay here again. We had our family of 5 and 2 grandparents on our 3 bedroom apartment attatched to the hotel and my mother--n-law opted for a single room in the main hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: beardown80
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a friendly staff. Comfortable room and close to Rialto and some good food. Have to walk a bit to san marco but thats the point in venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel with an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Dani_Florida
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with excellent staff and a really terrific location. It is remarkably close to the Rialto Bridge and adjacent to the Fruit and Vegetable Market (which is really a sight worth seeing). The staff can give recommendations to some very nice restaurants nearby and, this being Venice, all the sights are within strolling distance. Be advised, however, that all of the rooms require walking up at least one flight of stairs (this was a bit of a problem because my travel companion uses a cane).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Wonderful Staff and Great Room”
Reviews.Author: Brandidale
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel based on Rick Steves recommendation. We were not disappointed. It was in such a great location, right down from the fish market, a minute walk to the Rialto Bridge and shopping area, the gondolas and the water taxis. The room was extremely spacious and quiet, the bathroom large. There was no TV, which was perfectly ok with me, but was a disappointment to my husband. The host were absolutely great, very friendly and helpful with getting us directions to Murano Island and the local train station to get to our next destination. The breaksfast was superb! If there is something to say about Europe it is stairs, stairs, stairs and this hotel was no different. We definitely loved this hotel and would recommend to anyone! We would stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Fair Price”
Reviews.Author: Digdem
Reviews.Content: During my 2 day trip to Venice in October 2009, I had the pleasure of staying in Pensione Guerrato. I came to Venice, Santa Lucia Station by train from Bologna. Then I took an approximately 25 minute-long walk to the Guerrato. Since I didn't have many luggage and stuff, I preferred to walk there, but one can also take either a water taxi or a public transport water line to Rialto. But if you prefer to walk, following PER RIALTO signs you can easily access to Rialto area after a nice walk through old buildings and canals. Guerrato is a nice hotel at the heart of Venice, very close to Rialto Bridge and has a friendly staff, always kind and helpful. I made our reservation for 2, approximately 1.5 month ago. The hotel was almost full, and they offered us the room very near to the reception desk with a shared bathroom and they informed us that it might be a little bit noisy but we accepted it. Yes, the room was a little bit noisy as they said, but it didn't bother us since we knew it at the beginning. Our room was clean and comfortable. We had a sink in the room. The shared restroom was also clean all the time. We stayed on bed & breakfast and the breakfast was also satisfying. They serve fresh croissant, cheese, honey, jam, panini, coffee, orange juice and tea, also cereal and milk. The location of the hotel is great, 10-15 minute walk to San Marco. There are also many restaurants, cafes and bars around. It's very close to the public transportation points. For example, while we're getting back, we took the boat called the Orange Line to Marco Polo Airport from Rialto. One way is 13 euros and it takes app. 45 minutes. The staff was helpful. In the middle of the night, my husband had an headache, they find us some pain reliever and asked if we need anything else. Our first day in Venice was a very cold day, but when we came to the hotel at the evening, it was warm and nice. If you have a laptop or other mobile devices enabling internet connection, they give you the password for the wireless internet which I used several times during my stay. I guess, they generally prefer to be paid in cash and they made us a 5 euros discount for paying in cash. I saw three different people in the reception during my stay and all of them were kind and friendly. I recommend this hotel to the ones who are looking for a comfortable and budget stay in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great breakfast, very clean!”
Reviews.Author: JessicaKansasCity
Reviews.Content: We stay one night in October and loved it! It was a great location, right near the fish market and very close to the Rialto and just off the vaporetto stop. Beware though - the boat we took from the airport did not stop at the stop near the hotel (Rialto Mercato), it stopped at the main Rialto stop, so we got a little lost on our way to the hotel. Lots of restaurants and shopping nearby. The owners are fantastic - very friendly and helpful. The room was HUGE and very clean. Breakfast was served in a nice room in the lobby with lots of options. Great value for the price, we paid 130 euros with the Rick Steve's discount. Compared to the other hotels was stayed at in Italy, this was one of the best for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here as part of RIck Steves tour group. Great location to explore Venice from.”
Reviews.Author: Admiral_Zheng_He
Reviews.Content: Breakfasts taken with the tour group here were of excellent quality. My wife and I had the attic room, which was spacious and had nice views of the Venice rooftops through small windows. The bed was comfortable. There was good strong air conditioning, which is important when in Italy in the summer heat season. While we were in Venice, there was a daily fruit market operating in a little square just around the corner from Pensione Guerrato, which was convenient for grabbing fruit-on-the-go.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, lots of character”
Reviews.Author: kdf63
Reviews.Content: Pensione Guerrato is a gem in a great location in Venice. Its central location adjacent to the Rialto Market and just steps from the Rialto allowing easy access to all of the major sights. The room was nicely sized by European standards, neat, and clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. A simple breakfast is available to get a good start on the day. A great value in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful "Home Away From Home"!”
Reviews.Author: BethAB
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and some of the friendliest people in Venice!! Pensione Guerrato is a gem. The front desk folks are very friendly and helpful. I traveled with my 23 y.o. nephew (his first European trip) and we gave ourselves a workout on the steps and bridges of Venice -- walking for hours and hours a day. The Pensione was so well located (near Rialto Bridge and just around the corner from the fish market) that we were able to return to our room for an hour in the late afternoons and put our feet up before going off on another adventure and in search of a Venetian dinner. The vaporetti stop is just a few steps away (and no lugging your baggage up and down steps to cross bridges, which was a plus). Very convenient! The breakfast was very yummy. Every morning you are greeted with the smells of the fresh baked fruit croissants -- delicious. There are cereals and yogurts to choose from as well. It was enough to fuel us for for a few hours. I completley understand why Rick Steves likes this property so much for his groups. It's clean, lovely and an excellent "home" in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, and well priced”
Reviews.Author: leokc34
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were looking for a hotel that was reasonably priced and clean before and after our cruise. I found this little gem while reading Rick Steve's Venice tour book. The price was right and it was in an amazing location. If you got lost in Venice (which you will) all you need to do is go back to the Rialto bridge. Since they have opened up the new Vaporetto boarding point it is a 30 second walk away. The crowd at night was a little loud but we were so tired from the walking all day that we just fell asleep by the time our heads hit the pillows. My daughter was a little grossed out by the fish smell in the morning but by the time you go to bed at night it is gone. Staff was very friendly and helped to carry our luggage up to the room. The morning breakfast is served in a quaint little room and they provide coffee, juice, cereal, pastries and yogurt. We shared a bathroom but never once saw anyone else use the room. The first night before the cruise we had room number 9, which didn't have the best view. On the final night in Venice we had room 2 which looked out to the market and the canal. Venice is amazing to see!!! everyone should do it once in your life and at the Pensione Guerrato is a great place to stay. Thank you Roberto, Piero and everyone else who works there :)

Reviews.Title: “saved our holiday!”
Reviews.Author: wegenek
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that we spent the first night of our holiday on the mainland in Mestre, which was a big mistake. Once we realized this, we spent a morning calling around and luckily the Pensione Guerrato had a 3 bedroom apartment available for most of the days we needed. The apartment is on the 3rd floor (and there is no lift), but it was about the same price as 2 reasonably priced hotel rooms and had a kitchen, bathroom, and dining room. The staff were really helpful and the location was fabulous - 1 minute walk to the fish market, fresh fruit/veg stalls, and the Rialto Mercado vaporetto stop. San Marco was a 15 minute walk away through lots of atmospheric alleys. On the last night we moved to another 2 BR 2 bath apartment about 5 minutes walk away run by the same people - it was recently renovated and very comfy and stylish. The only room for improvement was breakfast - just croissants, rolls, juice, coffee, cereal, and yogurt; not bad, but it got old after a couple days. Also, the clientele is mostly older American cruise ship passengers, but they didn't seem to mind our rambunctious kids, age 2 and 4.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: asmOak
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had a great stay at Pensione Guerrato. We stayed in a room with a shared bathroom - the bathroom was very clean and was only shared with one other room. The location is perfect - right off a vaporetto stop and right in the middle of Venice. Lots of great cichetti, restuarants and bars very close by. Our room faced towards the Grand Canal and when you stuck your head out, you actually had a wonderful view of the canal! Our room was reasonably quiet and we slept well. Also, the air conditioner worked perfectly - we had a wonderfully cool room as quickly as we needed. The only downside - the bed was two rolling cots pushed together. The cots were very uncomfortable. Otherwise, a great place to stay in a city where is it hard to find quality for the price...

Reviews.Title: “Piccolo Guerrato is a great value”
Reviews.Author: Sue_in_Raleigh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Venice in June with our two teenagers. We had been to Venice before and were looking for something affordable. I came upon this apartment as part of the Pensione Guerrato website but could not find out much information about it so I wanted to share our experience! The apartment is in a great part of town- between San Marco and Rialto. It is off a quiet square with a good restaurant right outside and plenty more to choose from in the vicinity. There are two rooms- one large bedroom with a queen size comfortable bed and one room which has the kitchen and two twin beds. The bathroom was large and comfortable. There was a heat/AC unit that you could actually control yourself- we have stayed in budget European hotels before and paid for AC only to find it didn't really cool anything. The kitchen has refrigerator, microwave, table, 4 chairs and enough dishes and utensils to eat a simple meal. This was wonderful as we would frequently pick up pizza, panini or something else and eat at home to save on money. The website for the Piccolo Guerrato says that breakfast is included for guests but it wasn't- we were forwarned by another review. We decided to try breakfast there anyway for $5/ person since we had two hungry teenagers. Breakfast was a good deal as there was plenty to choose from for an Italian hotel breakfast and we ate it all! In the end we only ended up paying $10/ day for all of us for breakfast. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. I would not recommend this apartment for the traveler that needs a front desk for constant directions, ticket purhases etc. But if you are an experienced traveller that has a good sense of direction and a willingness to find things on your own it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A breath of fresh air in busy Venice!”
Reviews.Author: momfromcalgary
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after we finished a cruise. Arriving at 10 am, we fully expected to not have our room available but it was!!!! Friendly and helpful Pierre helped us carry our luggage up the two flights of stairs and stored our extra luggage in a locked room. Our room was large with a queen bed and two cots for our 6 and 9 year old boys as well as a clean and sparkling new bathroom. Despite the age of the building (13th century!!) it was clean and charming!! Breakfast was croissants, cereal, yogurt, coffee and juice-plenty for the morning of our trip home! The location is fantastic-a two minute walk from the Rialto Mercato stop and next to the market. Loved it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: snickersle
Reviews.Content: There were five of us traveling, so Pensione Guerrato allowed us to stay in an apartment that they had just refurbished. It was fantastic. There were two extremely large bedrooms, two bathrooms, and a fully equiped kitchen and living room. It even had a washer/dryer. We found the food in Venice to be very expensive and not so good, so we shopped daily at the nearby fish and produce markets and cooked our own gourmet meals. The fish and produce were fresh and delicious and the markets were something to experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto!!”
Reviews.Author: sookmei
Reviews.Content: The location is very convenient being near to the boat station & market. Rooms are clean & comfy beds. Only downside is we booked a room without washroom & need to share with other members. The staff members are very friendly and helpful. We woke up in the morning to the aroma of fresh croissant. Besides, they serve coffee, tea, juice, cereals, yogurt, pastries in a specially decorated room. In the morning, you'll awake to the sound of vendors singing happily while preparing to sell the days' fresh vegetables, fruits & seafood at the mercato . Thank you to Pensione Guerrato. Grazie & Ciao!!

Reviews.Title: “Ciao Lulu!”
Reviews.Author: Dolcefarniente_9
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I enjoyed our second stay here, before heading up to his home in Lerici. The pensione is in a great location-near public transportation, and a short walk to San Marco. The staff members are very knowledgeable and helpful, with directions and recommendations. A special thank you to Roberto and furry friend LuLu. We enjoyed daily chats with you. Venice is a city to be absorbed and savored. This hotel is a blink away from the produce market, fish vendors and a great cheese shop. Rooms are clean, comfy beds, and yes you'll get a little workout going upstairs, but you'll need to burn of the extra calories! Breakfast is plentiful: coffee, tea, juice, cereals, yogurt, pastries, fresh fruit, served in a very tastefully decorated room. Be sure to ask for directions to Al Nono Risorto-a "mom and pop" type restaurant, great for families. In the morning, you'll awake to the sound of vendors singing, the aroma of fresh baked goods, churchbells, and the click of high heels below on cobblestone streets. Bravo, Pensione Guerrato, Grazie!

Reviews.Title: “Charming decor managed by a friendly and helpful staff with reasonable rates makes Pensione Guerrato a great find!”
Reviews.Author: IoAmoItalia
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Pensione Guerrato after reading about it in Rick Steve's Italy 2008 and getting other recommendations from his website. We found Pensione Guerrato to be charmingly decorated and staffed by friendly and helpful employees. We booked late and got the room on the lobby floor with the separate bathroom; a mild inconvenience for the price and the convenience of the location. We stayed just one night in Venice, and the staff allowed us to keep our luggage in the hotel safe area while we toured more of Venice for a good portion of the day. The breakfast was decent, and gave us the fuel we needed to get our day going. The only negatives about Pensione Guerrato were the separate bathroom (our fault for booking late!) and the lack of elevator; but both were overshadowed by the convenience, price, helpful staff, and quaintness of the establishment. I will definitely be returning to Pensione Guerrato next time I visit Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ZeBear
Reviews.Content: Situated near the Rialto Market, it is just steps away from a water taxi stop. I prefer the dinner/night scene of the places on the west side of the Rialto, making this b&b a great pick. Standard breakfast spread (toast, pastry, cereal, fruit, coffee) and helpful staff 24/7. They have plenty of travel books which can be helpful if you need to check on updated prices/times of museums. Rooms were nicely decorated, met your needs...not super frilly but comfortable. My room had a window which faced construction, which might be annoying if you were to sit in your room all day (but who does that...you're in Venice)! So that wasn't an issue at all. Our room also had antique furniture and a classy venetian chandelier.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but we probably would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: terriann
Reviews.Content: First of all, as others have mentioned, the location is great!! We loved being near the Rialto Market and Rialto Bridge....we easily found the hotel when we arrived and were able to navigate back to it with no problems. Another plus was the nicely sized modern bathroom and shower. One negative was the very hard beds : my husband, two children (ages 16 and 21) and I all struggled with this. The biggest negative and reason we would not stay here again was the noise factor. We had a room on the 4th floor overlooking a small square. It was quiet during the day, but there was a cafe/bar that came alive at night with crowds of people talking and laughing until nearly 1:00 a.m.. Even with our windows closed, it was difficult to sleep. We stayed there the Thursday and Friday before Easter so maybe this noise is not the usual case, but I don't think we would chance staying there again. The staff was helpful with all of our requests, the breakfast was so-so.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful; Owners are Great”
Reviews.Author: Okscubagirl
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Pensione Guerrato for 5 nights (three nights as part of a Rick Steve's tour and two nights before the tour started).
