We were on the top floor so a good walk up 4 flights of stairs (but with all the gelato and pasta it was needed). We had a great view of the city and a square. The room was very roomy (much bigger then I expected based on other European experiences) and a very nice size bathroom with a towel warmer. Roberto, one of the owners and the other staff manning the desk were always welcoming and very helpful with questions. The breakfast was enough to get the day going and the women tending the breakfast room kept everything filled. The location was great - close to the Rialto bridge and right next to the outdoor produce and fish market. Very fun to walk through and pick up snacks each day. We did hear from others on the tour that if your room faced that side of the hotel - the vendors started setting up at about 4am each morning. We only had to contend with the bar in the square below our room. We only heard singing at 3am one morning.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay here”
Reviews.Author: TravelmoreWorkless
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. We spent 3 nights. The location is excellent (very close to the Rialto Bridge and steps to the markets) The staff was very friendly and helpful. They have a nice breakfast every morning that was included. We stayed on the top floor (with a view of a courtyard) the room was very clean and pretty good size and we would definitely recommend staying here to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: drillerdoc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel through the Rick Steves' tour and booked an extra day to arrive early. Great location only a few stops from the bus and train stations off the vaporetto. Just steps from the farmers market and the fish market and very easy walking distance to many shops and the Rialto Bridge. We got a double room, which was pretty spacious by Italian standards, with a nice sized bathroom and shower. The beds are firm but comfortable and sleep really wasn't an issue. The rooms were quiet, though the walls are a little thin and could be a problem if you have noisy neighbors. Breakfast is included with your stay, usually rolls, croissants, fruits, yogurt and cereal, along with coffee, tea and juice. A nice way to fuel up before visiting one of the most beautiful cities on earth. Just a few points of caution, there is no elevator, so you will needs to walk up a few flights of stairs to get to your room. Also management prefers cash and will charge more if you pay with a credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location! Helpful people!”
Reviews.Author: jbyers518
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by Rick Steves and because he books the place for 50 nights a year we decided to give it a try. Everyone was very helpful. I wish I cold remember the name of the lady who works at night with her cute Pug puppy. She was great. The room was clean and the location was excellent. Thanks to this staff we never got lost in Venice. When we go back we will stay here again. It's a bit noisy, but you are in the city!! Awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice for the Budget”
Reviews.Author: lasollover
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Rick Steve for mentioning this gem. Wonderfully located....no lugging bags great distances, also easy to find in a city where getting lost is just a given...you can always find your way home. Rooms were good sized and clean. Breakfast was well stocked and fresh. (one of the best we found in Italy) Staff was great. All in all it was a great find in a city where you can easily pay 300 Euro per night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic small hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ptrounstine
Reviews.Content: This place is a jewel. Large, clean, comfortable rooms; helpful, charming staff; excellent light breakfast; great location -- a short stroll either to the Rialto Bridge or the vaporetto stop at the fish market. We booked by email, mentioning Rick Steves and got the special cash price. We would stay here again in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: St_LouisMoFFGirl
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and spacious and in a great location. The breakfast was good as well. The room had a bad smell when you first entered the room. You get used to it after a few minutes. It was also noisy outside of the hotel room especially on the weekends because their was a bar behind the building. It is hard to know what other hotels are like in this price range. Venice is very expensive and this hotel suited our needs and budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gwjosh
Reviews.Content: This is an ideal hotel in Venice for people who want an easy base to walk around the city. It's easy to find with the hotel's directions, which says a lot--we saw tons of people walking around lost, carrying their suitcases over the bridges, so we were really happy to have found this place so easily. And it provides a great location to explore the city. We stayed in a room with only a sink and used the bathroom down the hall, which was very clean. I think we only had to share the bathroom with one other room, and we never had to wait. It was a great way to save some money. Piero, who works during the day, was extremely helpful and welcoming and gave us a great recommendation for dinner. Overall, we were very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location, cave-like, dank room”
Reviews.Author: lkglasgow
Reviews.Content: This was our least favorite hotel on our trip, but really it was our best bet for Venice. Venice is so expensive that to keep in budget this is where we had to go. The price was good, the location is GREAT, but the room we had really left something to be desired. It was dark with a funny smell and felt like a cave. That being said it was clean and all was in proper working order and it was amazingly quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: scrapitmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the apartment owned by Pensione Guerrato. It's listed as a 2-bedroom but it's really a one bedroom and the other beds are in the kitchen area. There were 5 of us and it was great for us. It's only a couple of blocks from St. Marks right next to San Zulian church. Private entrance door and then up one floor. The beds weren't that comfortable but honestly, I didn't find any that were in Italy. You have to go to the hotel to get the key. It would be nice if they just met you at the apartment and showed you how things worked. Took us forever to figure out the key (had to turn it 4 times to unlock all bolts). It would have been nice to have some local information/restaurant recommendations, etc in the room too. But overall, it was a clean, decent, local place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, adequate accomodations”
Reviews.Author: IslandGirl61
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our 2 night stay here. The staff are available 24 hours and very helpful. The room had little floor space and no tv or radio, but it was quiet. Wake-up call was reliable. Restaurant recommendations were good. It was an excellent location in the heart of the Rialto area to use as a base for daily sightseeing and wandering. If your plan is to use the room only to sleep and get dressed in, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Property in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BUBear
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 3 staying two nights at the Guerrato in early June 2008. We had no problem finding the accommodations. I had initially worried about staying on the 3rd floor, but the stairs proved to be no problem. We had room 32. It consisted of a huge bedroom composed of one queen bed and two twins pushed against one wall. We had space galore. The bathroom was also quite large with new, modern fittings. The shower was terrific. The view out over a square was quite nice. The double-glassed windows did a great job out keeping out exterior noise. Location of the pension is outstanding. The vaporette stop is just minutes away, fruit and vegetable market just outside the hotel front entrance, and the Rialto Bridge a nice 3 minute walk. Breakfast was pleasant and filling. Staff friendly and accommodating. We left with on complaints. For the wonderful city of Venice, the Pensione Guerrato is tremendous value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pensione in Venice”
Reviews.Author: IndianaNana
Reviews.Content: For anyone visiting Venice and looking for a reasonably priced hotel in a great location, I would highly recommend the Pensione Guerreto. This Pensione is listed as a one star hotel, but it couldn't be better. It is in a great location within a very easy walking distance of the Rialto Bridge. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but clean and comfortable. The Pensione has a wonderful breakfast room and serves a very nice breakfast. If you are looking for a deluxe hotel with five star ammenties, this hotel isn't for you, but if you are looking for a comfortable place to stay while you take in the sights of Venice, this hotel can't be beat. I've stayed here twice and have not been disappointed and if I ever have the opportunity to visit Venice again, this hotel will be first on my list of places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Owners are helpful and friendly”
Reviews.Author: manvstravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is hard to find at first but we didn't have any problems finding it again once we found our way around Venice. The location is great and all you have to do is step out of the hotel and go right and there is water transportation, which made it easy to get to the train station when we needed to leave. Our hotel room was very stark and after reading the reviews, we figured we had adjusted to what it would be like. It has a bed and not much else. (We like desks to place to charge our phones, laptops, etc.) There was no hotel internet access or in room access. The bathroom was a good size. Breakfast was the best of the three hotels we stayed at in Italy since they had fresh fruit (apples and bananas). If you go out the hotel and go left, then make a right, then another quick right, the restaurant that is on the small street, is wonderful. We had two great dinners with good food and service both times. The hotel recommended another restaurant, which we went to for lunch but it was crowded and the service left a lot to be desired. Overall, the hotel is very clean and has lovely furnishings throughout the floors. The owners are very sweet and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Snoopin'
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure Pensione Guerrato and Albergo Guerrato are the same place. Pensione Guerrato's web site says it was a convent built in 1227...but Albergo Guerrato was built in 1288 and, according to the innkeeper I spoke with, was never a convent. (I've attached a photo of the Albergo's dated plaque.) Just to clarify, we stayed in ALBERGO Guerrato for 3 nights and we loved it. Our room had a private bathroom which was nice. The breakfast each morning was lovely (cereals, pastries, juices, etc.). We were there during a heat wave so the in-room a/c was a great relief. The front desk staff were great and spoke English. They aren't there 24 hours a day though, so if you're checking out early in the morning, be sure to settle your bill before they leave for the evening. The walk over the Rialto could be strenuous and annoying if you have heavy luggage so be prepared for that - we had backpacks so it wasn't a big deal. Our room didn't have a view to speak of, but just a few steps outside the inn was all of Venice so who cares?!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky Guerrato - Good for the budget Traveler”
Reviews.Author: debsimmonds
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Guerrato the end of December 2007. At first glance, we were not impressed with this hotel. At second glance, weâ€™re still divided. Its understated entrance is an understatement â€“ down an alley, past discarded vegetable boxes-- a tiny sign over a single door. We were prepared for the flights of stairs to check in and additional flights to the rooms --we understand elevators donâ€™t work well in most Venice hotels, and lobbies are located on the second floor due to flooding. The quad/family room we reserved was very simply furnished with a two-twin double bed and two cot-size twins. The beds were not that comfortable. The twin beds were not only uncomfortable, they were child size, and not suitable for adult- size children. My college-age sonâ€™s feet hung over the end of the bed. The towels were skimpy in size and in short supply, the bathroom supplies unimpressiveâ€¦.. but the water was hot and the plumbing worked. The first night the room was freezing. The second night we realized that there was heat, they just hadnâ€™t turned it on in our room. The antiques were plentiful and the art objects gave the hotel a quirky charm. The plentiful breakfast was predictable â€“ cereal, juice, rolls, cheese and coffee â€“ lattes upon request. The Guerrato grew on us. In the end, we decided that we loved the location -- situated over the daily fresh market along the Grand Canal and just a short walk to the Rialto Bridge....close to all the action. Restaurants were plentiful in the area and excellent shopping was available just steps from the hotel, and over/ around/ beyond the Rialto bridge. St. Marks is an easy and pleasant walk through the interesting streets. From our window we had a delightful view over ancient Venice roof tops complete with cooing pigeons â€“ a treat to open our window every morning. The staff was always very friendly and helpful. They allowed us to leave our luggage in the lobby after checking out, before our late night train to Paris. I must say the Guerrato is a bargain in a city that easily commands $500 a night for accommodations that travelers continue to register complaints about. Itâ€™s difficult for hoteliers to keep everything in working order and updated--- even at the most expensive hotels. While the Guerrato wasnâ€™t one of our favorites during or 4 week Italy trip, we appreciated a clean, quiet, safe, efficient place to stay at an affordable price. Guerrato fit that bill. Iâ€™m not sure I would stay here again unless my travel budget dictated that I sacrifice some comfort for price. I may want to pay a little more for comfort and a touch more luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in Venice”
Reviews.Author: volcanolover
Reviews.Content: We had a room for 4 on the 1st floor, so no view. Still we were very pleased with the location and the value. The people at the front desk were always helpful with recommendations and the room was clean and attractive. Breakfast was excellent. The location, right next to the Rialto market, is great.

Reviews.Title: “Artistic gem”
Reviews.Author: headopin
Reviews.Content: A Rick Steves recommendation. Very pleasant folks at the desk, room (a triple) large and very comfortable. Good lighting. Hot water, good towels. Good breakfast View down ancient alley. Hotel decor is mostly quirky antiques-- moorish lamp, feather angel wings, huge chests and grand mirrors. Dramatic and fun. Big travel library on desk in lobby. Received thorough instructions from owned about finding a travel agency other than the rail station. New vaporatto stop nearer than Rialto, at the fish market. They send info when you confirm. Happy to be there.

Reviews.Title: “Give Piccolo Guerrato a try”
Reviews.Author: Marc_and_Tracy
Reviews.Content: This apartment is rented through the Pensione Guerrato. The instructions they give you for getting to and from the Pensione and the apartment are to leave everyone at the Rialto vaporetto stop. come to the Pensione and collect the key, pick up your party and head out for the apartment. This is good advice and sounds like a bit of a bother. It isn't at all. I walked over the Rialto and down the street for 2 minutes and found the Pensione with no trouble. I let them know we were going to join them for breakfast (5 Euros per person) and left with the keys. Walked back across the Rialto, picked up my party and cruised to the apartment following directions from the front desk staff. Friendly and good English. The apartment is very clean, and warm once you turn on the hot water/heater. I didn't ask about it but we figured it out quickly. The controls are in the kitchen which is well equipped. It's located near a church and has a lovely view of the piazza. We picked up food to keep in the refrigerator which could be reheated in the microwave for a snack. This turned out to be a good option because the dining in Venice was pricey. We liked having the freedom to come and go without passing back the key. The kids slept in the kitchen on two twin beds. Our bedroom was one of the largest I had during my trip, as was the bathroom. We were easy walking distance to St Mark's and the Rialto. We had a blast getting lost. One night we got lucky enough to hear a serenade from a gondolier as they rowed under the bridge. Amazing. I LOVE Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FLLocalyocal
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel just steps from Rialto. Good location to explore the area and not too far from St.Marks Square. Our room was very large but some of the rooms on the 1st and 2nd floor are quite small and dark. The view from our room was fantastic...however we were on the top floor (4th) and there are NO elevators....Keep that in mind when you book your stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Pensione Guerrato
HotelInfo.Address: Calle drio la Scimia 240/a | Rialto, 30125 Venice, Italy
